body:
Thanks for the quick reply! @jimthompson5802 

* because I would like to install the latest version which is v0.3.3, but when I type cmd `pip install ludwig`, it install the version v0.1.0 automatically. I don't know which part was wrong.
* the processor is Intel Core i9

One thing you can try is to be explicit on the version, e.g., `pip install ludwig==0.3.3`  

Let me know if this helps.

@jimthompson5802 I just try the cmd, here is the result looks like

> % pip install ludwig==0.3.3
Collecting ludwig==0.3.3
  Using cached ludwig-0.3.3.tar.gz (233 kB)
Requirement already satisfied: Cython>=0.25 in ./venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from ludwig==0.3.3) (0.29.23)
Collecting h5py<2.11.0,>=2.6
  Using cached h5py-2.10.0.tar.gz (301 kB)
Requirement already satisfied: numpy>=1.15 in ./venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from ludwig==0.3.3) (1.19.5)
Collecting pandas<1.1.5,>=0.19
  Using cached pandas-1.1.4-cp39-cp39-macosx_10_9_x86_64.whl (10.3 MB)
Requirement already satisfied: scipy>=0.18 in ./venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from ludwig==0.3.3) (1.6.3)
Requirement already satisfied: tabulate>=0.7 in ./venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from ludwig==0.3.3) (0.8.9)
Requirement already satisfied: scikit-learn in ./venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from ludwig==0.3.3) (0.24.2)
Requirement already satisfied: tqdm in ./venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from ludwig==0.3.3) (4.61.1)
Requirement already satisfied: tensorflow>=2.3.1 in ./venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from ludwig==0.3.3) (2.5.0)
ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement tfa-nightly==0.12.0.dev20201215223743 (from ludwig) (from versions: 0.13.0.dev20210514172808, 0.13.0.dev20210514175928, 0.13.0.dev20210515174335, 0.14.0.dev20210515174343, 0.14.0.dev20210515190502, 0.14.0.dev20210528092347, 0.14.0.dev20210529132209, 0.14.0.dev20210605230927)
ERROR: No matching distribution found for tfa-nightly==0.12.0.dev20201215223743

@victoriayue   I ran the `pip install` command you tried and was able to install ludwig 0.3.3.  I noticed from the install log provided, some of the components appear to be already stored in the local pip cache.  In my case, I'm installing into an empty environment and all components are downloaded.

As a test can you try an install that bypasses the local pip cache, i.e., force a download of all components.
```
pip install --no-cache-dir install ludwig==0.3.3
```

Let me how if this works for you.

@jimthompson5802  :(

 % pip install --no-cache-dir ludwig==0.3.3

Collecting ludwig==0.3.3

  Downloading ludwig-0.3.3.tar.gz (233 kB)
     |████████████████████████████████| 233 kB 1.6 MB/s 
Requirement already satisfied: Cython>=0.25 in ./venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from ludwig==0.3.3) (0.29.23)
Collecting h5py<2.11.0,>=2.6
  Downloading h5py-2.10.0.tar.gz (301 kB)
     |████████████████████████████████| 301 kB 10.3 MB/s 
Requirement already satisfied: numpy>=1.15 in ./venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from ludwig==0.3.3) (1.19.5)
Collecting pandas<1.1.5,>=0.19
  Downloading pandas-1.1.4-cp39-cp39-macosx_10_9_x86_64.whl (10.3 MB)
     |████████████████████████████████| 10.3 MB 6.4 MB/s 
Requirement already satisfied: scipy>=0.18 in ./venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from ludwig==0.3.3) (1.6.3)
Requirement already satisfied: tabulate>=0.7 in ./venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from ludwig==0.3.3) (0.8.9)
Requirement already satisfied: scikit-learn in ./venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from ludwig==0.3.3) (0.24.2)
Requirement already satisfied: tqdm in ./venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from ludwig==0.3.3) (4.61.1)
Requirement already satisfied: tensorflow>=2.3.1 in ./venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages (from ludwig==0.3.3) (2.5.0)
ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement tfa-nightly==0.12.0.dev20201215223743 (from ludwig) (from versions: 0.13.0.dev20210514172808, 0.13.0.dev20210514175928, 0.13.0.dev20210515174335, 0.14.0.dev20210515174343, 0.14.0.dev20210515190502, 0.14.0.dev20210528092347, 0.14.0.dev20210529132209, 0.14.0.dev20210605230927)
ERROR: No matching distribution found for tfa-nightly==0.12.0.dev20201215223743

For some reason, the pip install does not seem to be able to pickup `tfa-nightly==0.12.0.dev20201215223743`, which is one of the dependencies for ludwig 0.3.3.  

As a separate test, please try this pip install command.  We're now trying to see if there is a problem in installing that dependency.  
```
pip install tfa-nightly==0.12.0.dev20201215223743
```

@jimthompson5802 looks like the tfa-nightly doesn't have 0.12.0.dev20201215223743 version? just guess


pip install tfa-nightly==0.12.0.dev20201215223743

ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement tfa-nightly==0.12.0.dev20201215223743 (from versions: 0.13.0.dev20210514172808, 0.13.0.dev20210514175928, 0.13.0.dev20210515174335, 0.14.0.dev20210515174343, 0.14.0.dev20210515190502, 0.14.0.dev20210528092347, 0.14.0.dev20210529132209, 0.14.0.dev20210605230927)
ERROR: No matching distribution found for tfa-nightly==0.12.0.dev20201215223743

@victoriayue I may have an explanation. the `tfa-nightly` dependency is for the `tensorflow_addons` package. It appears that this version of the package was built for only Python 3.6, 3.7 and 3.8. Here is a screenshot of the [available downloads](https://pypi.org/project/tfa-nightly/0.12.0.dev20201215223743/#files) for this version of the tensorflow_addons package: As you can see there is no package file with the designation of `cp39` (aka Python 3.9). The highest is `cp38` (aka Python 3.8). From your initial posting, you indicated your Python version is 3.9. To install Ludwig 0.3.3, you'll have to create a virtual environment with Python 3.8 and install Ludwig in there. FWIW...I've been using Python 3.6 without issues. Let me know if this makes sense and if it helps you install ludwig.
@jimthompson5802 Thanks for the help. I try python 3.8 and it works!

issue.title: ModuleNotFoundError no module named 'tensorflow.contrib'
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Hello, sorry for asking the dummy question again.
when I run `ludwig train ...` in terminal, it shows `ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorflow.contrib'`

I faced the problem before when I start using Ludwig for the first [time](https://github.com/ludwig-ai/ludwig/issues/1208 ).
And the developer helped me fix that by changing the python version to 3.8
However, at this time, I think all the package version is correct, but it still not working. 
Hope someone could help me find the problem, thanks a lot!


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. iOS] ios
 - Version [e.g. 22] 
- Python version: 3.8
- Ludwig version 0.4
